title: Set up GitHub OAuth app and auth flow
description:
GitHub OAuth auth flow for /edit. Three parts:

1. Netlify Function (netlify/functions/auth-callback.js): exchanges OAuth code for access_token via GitHub API. Reads GITHUB_CLIENT_ID and GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET from env vars. Redirects to /edit/#token=... (fragment stays client-side).

2. Client module (static/edit/auth.js): exports getToken(), login(), logout(). On load, captures #token= from URL fragment into localStorage. getToken() falls back to DEV_TOKEN from config if no localStorage token. login() redirects to GitHub OAuth authorize URL. Single code path — no isLocal branching.

3. Config (static/edit/config.js): exports GITHUB_CLIENT_ID and DEV_TOKEN. Gitignored — config.example.js is the committed template. DEV_TOKEN enables local dev with a PAT, same code path as production.

app.js behavior: if no token, auto-redirect to OAuth (no sign-in button, no UI exposed to visitors). If token present, render editor shell.

title: Scaffold /edit SPA and Netlify routing
description: Scaffold the /edit SPA on the existing Zola site. Vanilla JS modules, no frameworks, no build tools. Dark/light mode support. SPA routing via Netlify redirects.

title: Build TOML frontmatter form editor
description: Structured form fields for Zola TOML frontmatter: title, date, description, taxonomies (tags/categories), draft flag, slug, extra fields (custom CSS/JS paths). Parse existing +++ frontmatter on load, serialize back on save.

title: Add visual editor for blog posts
description: Web-based visual editor for blog posts, served at /edit on the same Netlify deployment. Static SPA using GitHub OAuth for auth and GitHub Contents API for read/write. Each save = git commit (already on remote), push = live via Netlify. Markdown editor with structured TOML frontmatter fields. Supports per-page custom CSS/JS fields. No database — just a static app + one Netlify Function (OAuth token exchange) talking to GitHub API.
